intro: Adenoncos, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, often blooming in spring and summer. Adenoncos typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with some species having a slightly hairy texture.
